abstract: A view that enables you to display an AR experience with RealityKit.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/RealityKit/ARView
crawled: 2025-12-02T20:17:12Z
---

# ARView

**Class**

A view that enables you to display an AR experience with RealityKit.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor @objc @preconcurrency class ARView
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView] instance to display rendered 3D graphics to the user. You typically add a single view to your app’s storyboard, and then provide an outlet for that view in your code. Alternatively, you can create and add a view to your view hierarchy programmatically at runtime, as you would any other view.

A view has a single [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene] instance that you access through the read-only [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/scene] property. To the view’s [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Scene] instance you add one or more [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnchorEntity] instances that tell the view’s AR [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView/session] how to tether content to something in the real world. To each anchor, you attach a hierarchy of other [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/Entity] instances that make up the content of the scene.



Additionally, you can use the view to:

- Configure render options, environmental characteristics, and the camera mode.
- Handle platform-appropriate user interaction in the form of mouse, keyboard, or gesture input.
- Find entities at a given point in the view.
- Access statistics and visualizations that help you debug your app.

Note that with [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ARView], a [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/ModelEntity] casts a grounding shadow on a physical surface by default.  [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/RealityView] does not have this default behavior.

## Creating a view

- **init(frame:)**: Creates an AR view with the specified dimensions.
- **init(frame:cameraMode:automaticallyConfigureSession:)**: Creates an AR view with the specified dimensions, camera mode, and session configuration state.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates an AR view initialized from data in a given decoder.
- **init(frame:cameraMode:)**: Creates an AR view with the specified dimensions and camera mode.

## Working with the scene

- **scene**: The scene that the view renders and simulates.

## Configuring the AR session

- **session**: The AR session that supports the view’s rendering.
- **automaticallyConfigureSession**: An indication of whether to use an automatically configured AR session.
- **renderOptions**: The render options that configure the view’s AR session.
- **renderCallbacks**: A container that holds the view’s render callbacks.

## Providing environmental context

- **environment**: The view’s background, lighting, and acoustic properties.
- **physicsOrigin**: The entity that defines the origin of the scene’s physics simulation.
- **audioListener**: The entity that defines the listener position and orientation for spatial audio.

## Managing the camera

- **cameraMode**: A setting that chooses between the AR session’s camera and a virtual one.
- **cameraTransform**: The transform of the currently active camera.

## Finding entities at a point in the view

- **entity(at:)**: Finds the entity in the AR scene closest to the specified point.
- **entities(at:)**: Finds the collection of entities at the specified point in the scene.
- **hitTest(_:query:mask:)**: Searches for objects corresponding to a point in the view based on a query and a collision mask.
- **hitTest(_:types:)**: Searches for objects corresponding to a point in the view based on a set of result types.
- **makeRaycastQuery(from:allowing:alignment:)**: Creates a ray-cast query originating from a point in the view, centered on the camera’s field of view.
- **raycast(from:allowing:alignment:)**: Performs a ray cast, where a ray is cast into the scene from the center of the camera through a point in the view, and the results are immediately returned.
- **trackedRaycast(from:allowing:alignment:updateHandler:)**: Performs a tracked ray cast, where a ray is cast into the scene from the center of the camera through a point in the view.

## Adding gesture recognizers to entities

- **installGestures(_:for:)**: Installs standard gestures onto the given entity, configured to be recognized simultaneously.
- **gestureRecognizer(_:shouldRecognizeSimultaneouslyWith:)**

## Mapping between coordinate spaces

- **project(_:)**: Projects a point from the 3D world coordinate system of the scene to the 2D pixel coordinate system of the view.
- **unproject(_:ontoPlane:relativeToCamera:)**: Unproject a 2D point from the view onto a plane in 3D world coordinates.
- **unproject(_:ontoPlane:)**: Maps a 2D point from the view’s coordinate system onto the given plane in 3D space.
- **unproject(_:viewport:)**: Maps a 2D point from the pixel coordinate system of a viewport into a 3D coordinate space. The point lies on this view’s near clipping plane.
- **ray(through:)**: Determines the position and direction of a ray through the given point in the 2D space of the view.

## Handling touch input

- **touchesBegan(_:with:)**: Tells the view that one or more new touches occurred.
- **touchesMoved(_:with:)**: Tells the view when one or more touches associated with an event changed.
- **touchesEnded(_:with:)**: Tells the view when one or more fingers are raised from the view.
- **touchesCancelled(_:with:)**: Tells the view when a system event (such as a system alert) cancels a touch sequence.

## Handling keyboard input

- **acceptsFirstResponder**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the view accepts first responder status.
- **keyDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed a key.
- **keyUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released a key.

## Handling mouse input

- **mouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed the left mouse button.
- **mouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with the left button pressed.
- **mouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released the left mouse button.
- **mouseMoved(with:)**: Informs the view that the mouse has moved.
- **rightMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed the right mouse button.
- **rightMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with the right button pressed.
- **rightMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released the right mouse button.
- **otherMouseDown(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has pressed a mouse button other than the left or right one.
- **otherMouseDragged(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has moved the mouse with a button other than the left or right button pressed.
- **otherMouseUp(with:)**: Informs the view that the user has released a mouse button other than the left or right button.
- **scrollWheel(with:)**: Informs the view that the mouse’s scroll wheel has moved.

## Managing the view

- **frame**: The frame rectangle, which describes the view’s location and size in the coordinate system of the view’s superview.
- **contentScaleFactor**: The scale factor of the content in the view.
- **didMoveToSuperview()**: Tells the view that its superview changed.
- **didMoveToWindow()**: Tells the view that its window property is set to a new value.
- **layoutSubviews()**: Lays out subviews.
- **layout()**
- **layerClass**: The class used to create the layer for view instances.
- **makeBackingLayer()**: Creates the view’s backing layer.
- **viewDidChangeBackingProperties()**: Tells the view when its backing store properties change.
- **viewDidMoveToSuperview()**: Tells the view that it has a new superview or that the view’s superview has been removed.

## Taking a snapshot

- **snapshot(saveToHDR:completion:)**: Takes a screenshot.
- **snapshot(saveToHDR:completion:)**: Takes a screenshot.
- **ARView.Image**

## Debugging the session

- **Improving the Performance of a RealityKit App**: Measure CPU and GPU utilization to find ways to improve your app’s performance.
- **debugOptions**: The current debugging options.

## Structures

- **ARView.DebugOptions**: Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that can aid in debugging.
- **ARView.EntityGestures**: The set of possible entity gesture recognizers.
- **ARView.Environment**: A description of background, lighting, and acoustic properties for a view’s content.
- **ARView.PostProcessContext**: An object the framework uses to pass data to a postprocess callback.
- **ARView.RenderCallbacks**: A container that holds the view’s render callbacks.
- **ARView.RenderOptions**: The available rendering options that you use to selectively disable certain rendering effects.

## Instance Methods

- **gestureRecognizer(_:shouldReceive:)**
- **snapshot(saveToHDR:completion:)**: Takes a screenshot.

## Enumerations

- **ARView.CameraMode**: The available camera modes.

## Default Implementations

- **ARSessionProviding Implementations**

## UIKit and AppKit presentation

- **ARView.DebugOptions**: Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that can aid in debugging.
- **ARViewBase**: The platform-specific base class for the view into which RealityKit renders content.

## Inherits From

- NSView
- UIView

## Conforms To

- ARSessionProviding
- CALayerDelegate
- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSAccessibilityElementProtocol
- NSAccessibilityProtocol
- NSAnimatablePropertyContainer
- NSAppearanceCustomization
- NSCoding
- NSDraggingDestination
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSStandardKeyBindingResponding
- NSTouchBarProvider
- NSUserActivityRestoring
- NSUserInterfaceItemIdentification
- UIAccessibilityIdentification
- UIActivityItemsConfigurationProviding
- UIAppearance
- UIAppearanceContainer
- UICoordinateSpace
- UIDynamicItem
- UIFocusEnvironment
- UIFocusItem
- UIFocusItemContainer
- UIGestureRecognizerDelegate
- UILargeContentViewerItem
- UIPasteConfigurationSupporting
- UIPopoverPresentationControllerSourceItem
- UIResponderStandardEditActions
- UITraitChangeObservable
- UITraitEnvironment
- UIUserActivityRestoring
